body: I cannot reproduce any problem with `ui_texture_atlas_slice`: or `ui_texture_slice`: both of these examples are the only once using `BorderRect::square(22.0)` the only other example using `BorderRect` at all is `sprite_slice` which also looks good on my machine (MacOs)
This is the bleeding/drooling I mean, on `ui_texture_atlas_slice`
What's weird is that it still happens with the new shader version by @ickshonpe

@extrawurst It happense on my Mac so it might be related to pixel resolution.

But to reproduce you need to click enough times on the `ui_texture_atlas_slice` buttons to reach the same textures I displayed on my comment

@ManevilleF oh you are right, i never toggled them, had no idea that is what one can do ðŸ™ˆ 
now i can reproduce it on my mac
Or we can just make the border 2px wider in the example

My feeling is that i would prefer a documented fix so it can help anyone who runs into the same issue rather than hiding it away.

I don't understand why the bleeding appeared after #13620 though. All it does is move the scaling from extract to prepare..
Seems like this would be an easy fix to start from. Is it ok, if I do it?
Yep I'm fine with the simple fix getting merged.

issue.title: Increase border_rect for TextureSlicer to match image

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

- Fixes #14550 

## Solution

Increased the _border_rect_ for _TextureSampler_ to match image.

## Testing

- Compiled main branch from source and made sure problem exists
- Applied fix and rebuild to make sure problem doesn't exist anymore

## Showcase

### main

After some clicking on the buttons problem exists on main branch:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29636390-f33d-495d-8068-e652c20c12f3)

### this PR
Can not get the problem with the fix:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b891f188-e025-49c0-8523-7a98cb784b19)
